chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall u v w t : V, R (cons u v) (cons w t) -> R (cons v u) (cons t w)

Premises:
*** [ R : AV -> AV -> Prop ]
*** [ cons : V -> V -> AV ]
*** [ V : Type ]
Chasles_2 : forall u v w t : V, R (cons u t) (plus (cons u v) (plus (cons v w) (cons w t)))
Chasles : forall u v w : V, R (plus (cons u v) (cons v w)) (cons u w)
oppu_v : forall u v : V, R (cons (opp u) v) (plus pi (cons u v))
permute : forall u v : V, R (plus (cons u v) (cons v u)) zero
plus_zero : forall u v : V, R (plus (cons u v) zero) (cons u v)
zero_plus : forall u v : V, R (plus zero (cons u v)) (cons u v)
vR_R_compatible : forall u u' v v' : V, vR u u' -> vR v v' -> R (cons u v) (cons u' v')
u_oppv : forall u v : V, R (cons u (opp v)) (plus (cons u v) pi)
angle_cons : forall (a : AV) (u : V), exists v : V, R a (cons u v)
v_trans : forall u v w : V, vR u v -> vR v w -> vR u w
angle_nul : forall u : V, R (cons u u) zero
oppu_u : forall u : V, R (cons (opp u) u) pi
angle_plat : forall u : V, R (cons u (opp u)) pi
opp_compatible : forall u v : V, vR u v -> vR (opp u) (opp v)
v_sym : forall u v : V, vR u v -> vR v u
QArith_base.Qplus_le_compat : forall x y z t : QArith_base.Q, QArith_base.Qle x y -> QArith_base.Qle z t -> QArith_base.Qle (QArith_base.Qplus x z) (QArith_base.Qplus y t)
pi_plus_pi = ex_ind (fun (u : V) (_ : u = u) => transitive (compatible (symetrique (angle_plat u)) (symetrique (oppu_u u))) (transitive (Chasles u (opp u) u) (angle_nul u))) non_vide_V : R (plus pi pi) zero
v_refl : forall u : V, vR u u
opp_opp : forall u : V, vR (opp (opp u)) u
pi_plus_zero = ex_ind (fun (u : V) (_ : u = u) => transitive (compatible (symetrique (angle_plat u)) (reflexive zero)) (transitive (plus_zero u (opp u)) (angle_plat u))) non_vide_V : R (plus pi zero) pi
non_vide_V : exists u : V, u = u
ssrfun.svalP : forall u : {x : ?T | ?P x}, ?P (proj1_sig u) where ?T : [ |- Type] ?P : [ |- ?T -> Prop]
Inductive t : nat -> Set := F1 : forall n : nat, Fin.t (S n) | FS : forall n : nat, Fin.t n -> Fin.t (S n) Arguments Fin.t _%nat_scope Arguments Fin.F1 {n}%nat_scope Arguments Fin.FS {n}%nat_scope
Ring_theory.pow_pos : forall R : Type, (R -> R -> R) -> R -> BinNums.positive -> R
InitialRing.gen_phiN : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> BinNums.N -> R
Ring_polynom.PEeval : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.PExpr C -> R
Ring_polynom.r_list_pow : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> R -> R) -> list (R * BinNums.positive) -> R
Ring_theory.IDphi : forall R : Type, R -> R
InitialRing.gen_phiNword : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> InitialRing.Nword -> R
Ring_polynom.Pphi_pow : forall R : Type, R -> R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R) -> forall C : Type, C -> C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> forall Cpow : Type, (BinNums.N -> Cpow) -> (R -> Cpow -> R) -> (C -> option C) -> list R -> Ring_polynom.Pol C -> R
Ring_polynom.ropp_ext_Proper : forall (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req req) ropp
Ring_polynom.rmul_ext_Proper : forall (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req (Morphisms.respectful req req)) rmul
Ring_polynom.radd_ext_Proper : forall (R : Type) (radd rmul : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.ring_eq_ext radd rmul ropp req -> Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful req (Morphisms.respectful req req)) radd
Ring_theory.ARsub_def : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y : R, req (rsub x y) (radd x (ropp y))
Ring_polynom.mkadd_mult : forall R : Type, R -> (R -> R -> R) -> (R -> R -> R) -> forall C : Type, C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> (C -> option C) -> (R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> (R -> R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> R -> C -> list (R * BinNums.positive) -> R
Ring_theory.ARopp_mul_l : forall (R : Type) (rO rI : R) (radd rmul rsub : R -> R -> R) (ropp : R -> R) (req : R -> R -> Prop), Ring_theory.almost_ring_theory rO rI radd rmul rsub ropp req -> forall x y : R, req (ropp (rmul x y)) (rmul (ropp x) y)
Ring_polynom.mkmult_c_pos : forall R : Type, R -> forall C : Type, C -> (C -> C -> bool) -> (C -> R) -> (R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> (R -> R -> BinNums.positive -> R) -> C -> list (R * BinNums.positive) -> R
transitive : forall a b c : AV, R a b -> R b c -> R a c
Inductive clos_trans_1n (A : Type) (R : Relation_Definitions.relation A) (x : A) : A -> Prop := t1n_step : forall y : A, R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n A R x y | t1n_trans : forall y z : A, R x y -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n A R y z -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n A R x z Arguments Relation_Operators.clos_trans_1n _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t1n_step _%type_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.t1n_trans _%type_scope
compatible_croix : forall a b c d : AV, R a b -> R c d -> R (plus a d) (plus b c)

```proof
intros u v w t H.
apply (compatible_croix _ _ _ _ (Chasles_2 u v w t) (Chasles v w u t)).
```

original: proof intros u v w t H. apply (compatible_croix _ _ _ _ (Chasles_2 u v w t) (Chasles v w u t)).
